answered.question: How deep should the uv migration go?
answered.answer: Full uv — replace setuptools build backend, use uv in CI, uv for publish, drop pip entirely

answered.question: How should end users install jarkdown?
answered.answer: All three paths: uv tool install (primary), pipx install (alternative), pip install (fallback)

answered.question: Should uv.lock be committed to the repository?
answered.answer: Yes — commit uv.lock for reproducible dev and CI environments

answered.question: How aggressive should the CI migration be?
answered.answer: Full replacement — all CI jobs use uv, uv build for publishing, uv run for commands, drop pip caching

inferred.assumption: PyPI trusted publishing (OIDC) must continue working
